thread.title: Lufkin alumni named Valdosta State interim head coach
thread.title_full: Lufkin alumni named Valdosta State interim head coach

author: Jimmie Searfoss
title: Lufkin alumni named Valdosta State interim head coach
text:
VALDOSTA, Ga. â€” Valdosta State elevated Lufkin High School alumni Trent Earley to interim head coach Saturday, following the departure of former head coach Tremaine Jackson to Prairie View A&M.
"Coach Earley has been a big part of our success on the field," Valdosta State's Director of Athletics Troy Katen said. "He has tremendous relationships with all of our student-athletes, and we want to ensure that our culture and those relationships with our team stay intact."
Earley will continue duties as co-defensive coordinator and linebacker coach with his new role on the Blazers.
This is Earley's third season with the Blazers, where he made vast improvements on both special teams and defense, creating one of the best Division II squads in the Gulf South Conference.
The Blazers finished 13-1 in the 2024 season and lost the national championship game to Ferris State.
